intro: Luma ulei, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Luma ulei thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and cultural significance in Hawaiian traditions.
